definitions.usage: 指飞机离开地面开始飞行的行为，通常用于航空领域的正式或日常语境。

examples.scene: 你在机场候机大厅，听到广播宣布你的航班即将起飞。你看着窗外，飞机正在跑道上加速。
examples.chineseIdea: 描述飞机离开地面的动作，强调过程平稳且令人期待。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The pilot announced that the plane would have a @ @ soon.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The pilot announced that the plane would have a 「smooth takeoff」 soon.
examples.chineseTranslation: 飞行员宣布飞机很快将进行「平稳起飞」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The plane will fly up smoothly.' 纠正：'The plane will have a smooth takeoff.'（'fly up'不够具体，航空术语中常用'takeoff'描述起飞动作。）

examples.scene: 你和朋友讨论最近一次飞行经历，提到因为天气原因，航班推迟了起飞时间。
examples.chineseIdea: 表达起飞因外部因素被推迟，带有轻微的抱怨情绪。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Due to the storm, our flight experienced a @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Due to the storm, our flight experienced a 「delayed takeoff」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 由于暴风雨，我们的航班经历了「起飞延误」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The plane was late to fly.' 纠正：'The flight experienced a delayed takeoff.'（'late to fly'模糊且不专业，'delayed takeoff'更符合航空语境。）

definitions.meaning: 经济或事业的腾飞/迅速发展
definitions.usage: 比喻某事物（如经济、事业或项目）快速增长或成功起步，常用于商业或描述趋势的语境。

examples.scene: 你在新闻报道中读到中国某个城市因科技产业而经济迅速增长，成为全国关注的焦点。
examples.chineseIdea: 描述一个地区经济快速起飞，强调速度和成就。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The city’s tech industry led to an @ @ in the past decade.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The city’s tech industry led to an 「economic takeoff」 in the past decade.
examples.chineseTranslation: 该市的科技产业在过去十年引发了「经济腾飞」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The city’s economy fly high.' 纠正：'The city experienced an economic takeoff.'（'fly high'不适合描述经济，'takeoff'更贴合快速发展的比喻。）

examples.scene: 你和同事讨论一个初创公司，因为获得大额投资而迅速扩张。
examples.chineseIdea: 强调公司因外部助力而快速起步，带有赞叹的语气。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: After securing funding, the startup saw a @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: After securing funding, the startup saw a 「rapid takeoff」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 在获得资金后，这家初创公司迎来了「迅速腾飞」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The company grow very fast.' 纠正：'The company experienced a rapid takeoff.'（'grow very fast'缺乏比喻色彩，'takeoff'更生动且专业。）

definitions.usage: 指对某人或某事进行幽默的模仿或讽刺性表演，常用于娱乐或社交场合。

examples.scene: 你在看一档喜剧节目，演员模仿某位名人，观众笑声不断。
examples.chineseIdea: 描述演员通过夸张表演模仿名人，带来幽默效果。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The comedian’s @ @ of the politician had everyone laughing.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The comedian’s 「funny takeoff」 of the politician had everyone laughing.
examples.chineseTranslation: 喜剧演员对政客的「搞笑模仿」让大家都笑了。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The comedian copy the politician funny.' 纠正：'The comedian did a funny takeoff of the politician.'（'copy'不准确，'takeoff'更适合描述幽默模仿。）

examples.scene: 你在朋友聚会上，有人模仿电影中的经典场景，逗得大家捧腹大笑。
examples.chineseIdea: 表达模仿表演的巧妙和娱乐性，突出创意的成分。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Her @ @ of the movie scene was spot-on.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Her 「clever takeoff」 of the movie scene was spot-on.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她对电影场景的「巧妙模仿」非常到位。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'She act the movie scene very good.' 纠正：'She did a clever takeoff of the movie scene.'（'act'和'very good'不够具体，'takeoff'更适合描述创意模仿。）
